channel.title: INtopBackup
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from INtopBackup, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Sovereignty beats out favorite Journalism to win the Kentucky Derby
item.description: The victory hands Venezuelan jockey Junior Alvarado his first career win in the Kentucky Derby. Sovereignty's trainer, Bill Mott, has won the Kentucky...

item.title: The Vatican installs chimney to signal the selection of the next pope
item.description: Ahead of the election of the next pope, a chimney was installed atop the Sistine Chapel on Friday, which will help notify the public of the 267th pope...

item.title: Katie Ledecky breaks her own world record in the 800-meter freestyle
item.description: Katie Ledecky now has the top 10 performances all-time in the event, according to USA Swimming.

item.title: Young men were getting a haircut ahead of Swedish festival - then they were shot dead
item.description: The Swedish city Uppsala broke into party spirit this week - but the killing of hair salon customers still wearing their capes left many shaken.

item.title: Jewels linked to Buddha remains go to auction, sparking ethical debate
item.description: Buddha’s sacred jewels, unearthed in 1898, head to auction at Sotheby’s, raising ethical concerns.

item.title: 5.4-magnitude earthquake rattles rural southeastern New Mexico, West Texas
item.description: The U.S. Geological Survey reports that the earthquake's epicenter was about 35 miles south of Whites City, New Mexico.

item.title: The Bathtub Murder of Kendy Howard
item.description: Did a former Idaho state trooper use his law enforcement skills to stage his wife’s death in their bathtub? "48 Hours" correspondent Peter Van Sant re...

item.title: 2 killed when small plane crashes into Simi Valley neighborhood
item.description: Residents were inside of both homes at the time of the crash, but firefighters say they were able to make it out unharmed.

item.title: How Katy Perry became the Hot and Cold popstar
item.description: The US singer says she feels "bruised" after weeks of online backlash - what's sparked the change?

item.title: Vast crowd enjoys free Lady Gaga concert in Brazil
item.description: More than two million people attend a Lady Gaga concert on Copacabana beach, paid for by Rio de Janeiro city to help boost the economy.

item.title: Clair Obscur: How a passion project became 2025's most talked-about game
item.description: The makers of a video game that even impressed the French president tell the unusual tale of its development.

item.title: 2 wounded in shooting at Spartan College in Inglewood; suspect in custody
item.description: Two of the victims were believed to be female employees of the college, Inglewood's mayor told CBS News Los Angeles.

item.title: A telescope's powerful new tool may offer a better way to predict solar storms
item.description: The Daniel K. Inouye telescope snapped a clear image of sunspots.

item.title: Actress and 'Laugh-In' comedian Ruth Buzzi dies at 88
item.description: Buzzi, who was best known for her regular appearances on the NBC variety TV show Rowan & Martin's Laugh-In , died on Thursday at her home in Texas.

item.title: Florida lawmakers try to balance condo safety with cost
item.description: Florida lawmakers have sent the governor a bill that would provide financial relief to condo owners. The measure softens mandates passed after the dea...

item.title: Musk gets his Texas wish. SpaceX launch site is approved as the new city of Starbase
Warren Buffett shocks shareholders by announcing his intention to retire at the end of the year
item.description: Buffett said he will recommend to Berkshire Hathaway’s board that Greg Abel should become CEO at the end of the year.

item.title: Warren Buffett’s best and worst investments in his 60 years leading Berkshire Hathaway
